metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0433 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In blk_mq_queue_tag_busy_iter of blk-mq-tag.c, there is a possible use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-151939299

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.121').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.71~16.04.1').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.83').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
